title: Daisy in the Desert
description: How do different animals live in their environments? Daisy in the Desert is a cute poem that helps teach readers about the importance of animal adaptations in a fun and engaging way. Daisy the Alpaca is ready for a break from the cold mountains of Peru, so she travels across the world to visit her camel cousin Darla. However, Daisy quickly learns that she is not quite cut out for desert life. The book can also be used to teach students how to compare and contrast and to identify and use quotation marks.
